info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 5:26PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Kern County through 600 PM PDT... At 525 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rosamond, or 13 miles northwest of Lancaster, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rosamond. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
